repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Sergipe State Integrated Project :
            Rural Poverty

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Sergipe State Integrated
            Project Rural Poverty for Brazil were as follows: overall
            outcome was moderately unsatisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was substantial, and both the Bank and
            the borrower performance were moderately unsatisfactory.
            Some important project lessons learned were: (1) Targeting
            goes well beyond ensuring that project benefits reach the
            neediest. It is also a function of matching subprojects to
            communities' financial, managerial and technical
            capacity, and their knowledge of local conditions, in the
            equation supporting approval. (2) Fomenting community demand
            without commensurate capacity or resources to filter,
            evaluate, approve and finance the resulting proposals serves
            no useful purpose. In this case it was the outcome of
            poorly-designed information campaigns and well-intentioned
            councils without guidance on the financing likely to be
            available in a given year. (3) The inclusion of
            environmental subprojects implies a significant task in a
            Community-driven Development (CDD) context of information
            dissemination, technical assistance and awareness-building.
            (4) The sourcing and quality of technical assistance is as
            important as its financing and needs attention from the
            earliest stages of project development. (5) Cross sector
            integration/leveraging is a complex, challenging and
            long-term process intended to maximize the
            cost-effectiveness and impact of development/poverty
            reduction programs and policies. (6) The Project
            re-confirmed the longstanding lesson of CDD, that
            beneficiary involvement throughout the subproject cycle is
            essential for suitable, well-targeted and sustainable subprojects.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Sergipe Integrated Rural Poverty
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Sergipe
            Integrated Rural Poverty Project is to: a) improve the rural
            poor's access to basic socioeconomic infrastructure, b)
            raise incomes and capital assets through investments in
            productive activities and increased linkages between small
            producers and markets, and c) strengthen the cross-sector
            integration of investments in rural areas through improved
            participatory planning and monitoring at the local,
            municipal and State levels. This restructuring paper seeks
            approval to introduce changes in the referenced loan, namely
            1) to change the borrower's representative from the
            secretariat of planning to the secretariat of agriculture
            and rural development; 2) to extend the project closing date
            from December 31, 2011 to June 30, 2012; and 3) to
            reallocate the loan proceeds as set out in schedule two of
            the loan agreement for the project.

display_title.display_title:
Brazil - Sergipe Integrated Rural
            Poverty Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
